result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric M Zukaitis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid forthwith - in lieu of payment, defendant to serve 5 days jail consecutive to the 60 days jail, and concurrent to current revocation sentence. Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Straight time, to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System concurrent to the defendant's current revocation sentence from Washington County. 42 days credit granted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric M Zukaitis

defendant.name: Zukaitis, Eric M
defendant.address: 500 E Parrish Street, Prairie Du Chien Correctional, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change. Terminated - Institution.
Detainer Lift placed with Prairie du Chien Correctional
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Eric M Zukaitis in court by video from Prairie du Chien, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

Prior to calling case on record, Atty Menden affixes signature on plea questionnaire with the Defendant's permission. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #3. Court finds the Defendant guilty of count #3. 
Counts #1, 2,  and 4 are dismissed and read in. 
FELONY WARNINGS GIVE RE: VOTING RIGHTS AND FIREARM RESTRICTIONS.

State makes sentencing arguments. Atty Menden makes sentencing arguments. Defendant makes statements. 

Court orders the following:	
60 Days in the Waukesha County Jail 
42 days credit
Concurrent to:Current Revocation Sentence (Washington County Case)
To be served in the State Prison System

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid forthwith, in lieu of payment defendant to serve 5 days jail consecutive to the 60 days jail concurrent to current revocation sentence
The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 28, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Detainer placed at: Prairie Du Chien Correctional

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

02:33 PM Defendant Eric M Zukaitis in court by zoom video, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden, in person.   Andrew Nesheim appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defense has filed a preliminary hearing questionnaire and waiver.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Menden requests the defendant be allowed to appear by video for the plea and sentencing date.  The Court advises Attorney Menden to contact the Trial Court to ensure a video appearance will be sufficient.  If Trial Court will allow a video appearance, clerks office to set up a video from Prairie Du Chien, otherwise an Order to Produce will need to be done.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
email confirmation from Prairie Du Chien
